title: 移民加拿大｜加拿大移民新政策

replies.msg:
加拿大政府前日發聲明，表示為回應中國在香港實施國安法，將為港人移民加拿大提供多項便利措施，五年內於加國或海外認可大學或高等院校畢業的港人，可申請最長三年的加國工作簽證，在加拿大工作滿一年及符合相關要求，將合資格申請成為永久居民，亦可為伴侶、子女申請到加國團聚，當局會加快相關審批。

點解單嘢無左下文
上次講嗰啲只係大綱，要轉化為政策可能會有少少改動需要時間

IRPR應該已經有相應改動
https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/corporate/publications-manuals/operational-bulletins-manuals/service-delivery/hong-kong.html

Priority processing is one of the measures available to residents of Hong Kong. You can get priority processing if you’re applying for one of the following:

Canadian passport
permanent resident travel document (PRTD)
visitor visa
electronic travel authorization (eTA)
work permit
study permit
family sponsorship

replies.msg:
You become a spy now?

You don't have to call them. The wait is over 2 hours on the phone.
Why can't you create an account? You can use a sign in partner like your on line bank sign in

https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/e-services/cra-login-services/cra-user-password-help-faqs/registration-process-access-cra-login-services.html#hlp1a

How do I register for a CRA user ID and password?
My Account for Individuals
You will have to complete two steps.

Step 1 – Provide personal information

Enter your social insurance number.
Enter your date of birth.
Enter your current postal code or ZIP code.
Enter an amount you entered on one of your income tax and benefit returns. Have a copy of your returns handy. (The line amount requested will vary. It could be from the current tax year or the previous one.) To register, a return for one of these two years must have been filed and assessed.
Create a CRA user ID and password.
Create your security questions and answers. You can also decide if you want a persistent cookie added to your computer, so you can access CRA Login Services using that same computer later without being asked for more identification.
After you complete step one of the registration process, you will have access to limited tax information on My Account. After you enter your CRA security code, you will have access to the full suite of services available in My Account, as well as the Auto-fill my return service.

Step 2 – Enter the CRA security code

To access your account, return to My Account for Individuals, select "CRA login," and enter your CRA user ID and password. When prompted, enter your CRA security code.

You can log into CRA Login Services with a Sign-in Partner. This option lets you log in with a user ID and password that you may already have, such as for online banking. For more information, see Sign-in Partners Help and FAQs.

How do I register for a CRA user ID and password?
My Account for Individuals
You will have to complete two steps.

Step 1 – Provide personal information

Enter your social insurance number.
Enter your date of birth.
Enter your current postal code or ZIP code.
Enter an amount you entered on one of your income tax and benefit returns. Have a copy of your returns handy. (The line amount requested will vary. It could be from the current tax year or the previous one.) To register, a return for one of these two years must have been filed and assessed.
Create a CRA user ID and password.
Create your security questions and answers. You can also decide if you want a persistent cookie added to your computer, so you can access CRA Login Services using that same computer later without being asked for more identification.
After you complete step one of the registration process, you will have access to limited tax information on My Account. After you enter your CRA security code, you will have access to the full suite of services available in My Account, as well as the Auto-fill my return service.

Step 2 – Enter the CRA security code

To access your account, return to My Account for Individuals, select "CRA login," and enter your CRA user ID and password. When prompted, enter your CRA security code.

You can log into CRA Login Services with a Sign-in Partner. This option lets you log in with a user ID and password that you may already have, such as for online banking. For more information, see Sign-in Partners Help and FAQs.

You should get your tax refund for 2016, 2017, 2018 and 2019 soon.
After you get those assessments notice, you can register then.

Enter an amount you entered on one of your income tax and benefit returns. Have a copy of your returns handy. (The line amount requested will vary. It could be from the current tax year or the previous one.) To register, a return for one of these two years must have been filed and assessed.

The following is a list of specific situations that prevent you from filing a tax return through the NETFILE service:

Your tax return was discounted by a third party

You are filing a tax return for an individual who died in 2019 or 2020
Your social insurance number or individual tax number begins with 08 or 09

replies.msg:
綜合咁多個POSTS連登仔討論, 已發現香港人肯移民既最低條件
1. 要大幅加人工
2. 要低稅過香港
3. 要保證一家大細,老婆,仔女,鄰居,同學,朋友, 全部無條件移民
4. 要同當地人福利體齊
5. 要有足夠錢係完全唔做野情況下生活5年以上
6. 要一移民就馬上置業
7. 要到當地維持香港生活模式
8. 要物價低過或同香港相約
9. 要大家移去同一個地區
10. 要當地人唔准歧視自己
11. 要識講流利英文同當地語言同方言
12. 要有專業技能, 如律師, 醫生等
13. 要住大城市
14. 要交通方便過香港
15. 要返方便隨時來往香港既地點
16. 要一落地就成為公民, 唔需要住 N 年或讀書等條件
17. 要有香港既食物選擇
18. 要物價低過香港
19. 要當地一個中國人都冇
20. 要當地香港人全部都係黃絲
21. 要做非藍領既工作, 餐廳超市果D一律唔做
22. 要上網快過香港
23. 要有亞洲餐廳係附近
24. 要至少有1000萬財產或本身有樓可賣
25. 要做太空人係香港繼續返工同時, 該國唔可以收稅, 又繼續畀戶籍你
26. 要返工唔可以辛苦過香港

99. 要保證你出發前, 以上所有條件成立

https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/news/2021/02/canada-launches-hong-kong-pathway-that-will-attract-recent-graduates-and-skilled-workers-with-faster-permanent-residency.html

Canada.ca Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada Newsroom
Canada Launches Hong Kong Pathway that will Attract Recent Graduates and Skilled Workers with Faster Permanent Residency
From: Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada

News release
February 4, 2021—Ottawa — The ties that bind Canada and Hong Kong run deep. The first Hong Kong residents arrived here over 150 years ago, contributing immensely to Canada’s economic, social and political life. Canada continues to stand shoulder to shoulder with the people of Hong Kong, and is deeply concerned about the new National Security Law and the deteriorating human rights situation there. Against this backdrop, in November 2020, the Honourable Marco E. L. Mendicino, Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship, announced several new initiatives to help more Hong Kong residents come to Canada.

Today, Minister Mendicino announced that Hong Kong residents will be able to apply for new open work permits beginning on February 8, 2021. Valid for up to 3 years, these permits will allow Hong Kong residents to gain valuable employment experience and make significant contributions to Canada. Hong Kong residents must have graduated with a Canadian post-secondary diploma or degree in the last 5 years, or hold an equivalent foreign credential. A post-secondary diploma program must be a minimum of 2 years.

Hong Kong residents currently in Canada temporarily, including visitors, students and workers, can apply online from within Canada. Those applying from abroad remain subject to current travel restrictions and may not be able to come to Canada at this time, unless they have a job offer or meet a travel exemption and comply with all public health requirements. More details will be available on the IRCC website on the launch date.

In addition to open work permits, the Government of Canada continues to implement 2 other pathways to permanent residence for young Hong Kong residents, which will be available later this year. The first will be for Hong Kong residents with at least 1 year of work experience in Canada and who meet the language and education criteria. The second will be for Hong Kong residents who have graduated from a post-secondary institution in Canada; who can then apply directly for permanent residence. More information will be available in due course.

Quotes
“The launch of the Hong Kong immigration pathway is a historic initiative that will attract young, talented and experienced graduates who will help to drive Canada’s economy forward. With flexible open work permits and a fast-track to permanent residency, skilled Hong Kong residents will have a unique opportunity to develop their careers and help accelerate Canada’s economic recovery. This is a landmark immigration initiative that will strengthen our economy and will deepen the ties between Canada and the people of Hong Kong.”

– The Honourable Marco E. L. Mendicino, P.C., M.P., Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship

https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/e-services/cra-login-services/cra-user-password-help-faqs/registration-process-access-cra-login-services.html#hlp1a

How do I register for a CRA user ID and password?
My Account for Individuals
You will have to complete two steps.

Step 1 – Provide personal information

Enter your social insurance number.
Enter your date of birth.
Enter your current postal code or ZIP code.
Enter an amount you entered on one of your income tax and benefit returns. Have a copy of your returns handy. (The line amount requested will vary. It could be from the current tax year or the previous one.) To register, a return for one of these two years must have been filed and assessed.
Create a CRA user ID and password.
Create your security questions and answers. You can also decide if you want a persistent cookie added to your computer, so you can access CRA Login Services using that same computer later without being asked for more identification.
After you complete step one of the registration process, you will have access to limited tax information on My Account. After you enter your CRA security code, you will have access to the full suite of services available in My Account, as well as the Auto-fill my return service.

Step 2 – Enter the CRA security code

To access your account, return to My Account for Individuals, select "CRA login," and enter your CRA user ID and password. When prompted, enter your CRA security code.

You can log into CRA Login Services with a Sign-in Partner. This option lets you log in with a user ID and password that you may already have, such as for online banking. For more information, see Sign-in Partners Help and FAQs.

You should get your tax refund for 2016, 2017, 2018 and 2019 soon.
After you get those assessments notice, you can register then.

Enter an amount you entered on one of your income tax and benefit returns. Have a copy of your returns handy. (The line amount requested will vary. It could be from the current tax year or the previous one.) To register, a return for one of these two years must have been filed and assessed.

https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/e-services/e-services-individuals/netfile-overview/eligibility.html

SIN starts with 8 or 9 can not register with CRA.

Other restrictions
The following is a list of specific situations that prevent you from filing a tax return through the NETFILE service:

Your tax return was discounted by a third party
You are considered a deemed resident (that is, you don’t have to pay provincial or territorial tax)
You are filing a tax return for an individual who died in 2019 or 2020
Your social insurance number or individual tax number begins with 08 or 09

replies.msg:
如果你個會計佬個software 唔係平野個Ｄ
應該今年個分可以efile (前提係你之前個Ｄ，2014年之後個Ｄ要completed, 稅局接受最近７年既tax return, 所以2012年就......無理由做囉）
依家疫情乜Ｑ都慢，仲要係paper file
咁你個9字頭咁多年既話有可能會expire （雖然機會好細）
如果你收到佢個assessment 就即係睇左
咁你既efile應該得（你搵商場個Ｄ H&R Block應該實得）

不過如果你想DIY 既話，網上有Ｄ係可以自己做efile
如果冇乜特別要求，可以唔駛錢（個人suggest用網上，唔好用APP個Ｄ）
https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/e-services/e-services-individuals/netfile-overview/certified-software-netfile-program.html
去搵"Free Products"睇下邊間.....DIY做都得
